headline: Homemade Dumplings
description: These homemade dumplings are light, fluffy, and tender. They're quick and easy to make and delicious in chicken soup and stews.

video.description: See how to make light, savory homemade dumplings for stews.
video.name: Dumplings

name: Homemade Dumplings

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Stir in milk and mix until a batter forms that is thick enough to be scooped with a spoon. Allow batter to rest for 3 to 5 minutes.
Drop batter by spoonfuls into boiling stew or soup. Cover and simmer without lifting the lid for 15 minutes. Serve.

review.reviewBody: As with all dumpling recipes I find there‚Äôs never enough liquid in the recipes. So I followed your recipe but ended up adding approximately a 1/4 cup of water. Theses were the best dumplings I‚Äôve made.
Great flavor
Made these exactly as recipe described. I even added 1 tablespoon of parsley. These were fantastic!
Double recipe. Used butter. Excellent. Thanks
Easy peasy and my family loves it. They think I can cook!
Made this recipe exactly as written and it came out super doughy and glue like in consistency.
Yum! I used real butter in place of the margarine and and replaced the milk with buttermilk and did a half and half of dried chives and parsley! Turned out great thank you
Easy recipe üòã very tasty
Best, fluffiest dumplings ever.
The holier that art thou description of your cooking habits and BAM you use margarine ü§¢ IF I use this recipe I'll definitely be upgrading to butter. Get a grip
Easy! Put them in a turkey stew. Turned out great. Makes 6 perfect size dumplings. I recommend this recipe.
Made these tonight. Fantastic. It's freezing today so Chicken and Dumplings to the rescue

Made a Venison stew and added the dumplings!! Brought beef stock to a boil and used a batter scoop to add dumplings, turned down to simmer, covered for 15 minutes. They were perfectly light and fluffy!! The dumplings simmering made the broth thicken up nicely which I added to the stew. I cut up the butter and then mixed it by hand with the dry ingredients before adding the milk. I will definitely make them again!!
Never made dumplings before. Easy and tasty recipe
Delicious, light and fluffy. Just have to mix dry ingredients well so they don't taste like baking powder. Didn't make any changes to recipe.
Great! I forgot the sugar! My bad, Dumplings good anyway!

I made chicken and dumplings. In addition to the recipe‚Äôs ingredient amounts I added 1/2 more to make more dumplings and they turned out great! The dumplings were light and fluffy. I did add a generous pinch of dried parsley to the batter and loved it! Gonna keep this recipe close at hand for lots of future dinners
Follow directions and I made the dumplings a little smaller, so more and OMG, I'm a southern gal and this is the bomb.
This recipe was awful. The dumplings have a horrible aftertaste of baking powder I'm guessing. I'll stick to bisquik from now on. Yikes.

Just made this tonight and it turned out tender and didn't fall apart at all. I didn't make any changes I just doubled the recipe. My husband and I have the stomach virus and we needed something light that wouldn't bother our stomach and this was it. I boiled them in chicken stock Great recipe will be making this again. Thank you for sharing

Followed recipe except substituted 1/4 cup chicken stock for 1/4 cup of milk. Also added freshly chopped parsley at 1/2 of what is recommended. Brought to neighbors during recent cold spell. Received RAVE reviews, will make again, but the AA lady who cooked for us always used lard and, in my opinion, nothing beats a lard based dumpling.
I followed the recipe exactly (I thought) and these came out very dense, heavy, and gummy.
Extremely easy and quick to make. I didn‚Äôt change anything and they were really good. Never made chicken and dumplings before but will be making them again. Btw I used butter.
Reminds me of the dumplings my mom used to make in her beef stew, and that was exactly what I had made. Filled my heart!
Easy with a great taste.
Do NOT use butter. Use shortening. These feel apart before I got my second bowl of soup. They tasted ok but don't have longevity.
Great recipe. I used the broth instead of milk and skipped the salt. (broth had enough salt to add flavour to dumplings)

DUMPLINGS did not look right, they did not hold shape, were mushy and broth became super thick. Wish those who can make great dumplings will add photos on the consistency of the dough before it's spooned into the broth. (THIS MIGHT HELP ME) thanks for your post. I used butter instead of margarine and spooned dough into simmering soup.
Delicious and easy.
I really enjoyed these. Made the recipe, and then by the spoonful, dropped into a hot vegetable soup. Perfect, just like my grandma used to make.

First time ever making dumplings, my mom uses bisquick, didnt have any but had all the ingredients for this recipe, they were amazing. Used them with chicken and dumplings. They were not doughy and delicious, I made mine a bit bigger so I cooked for 18 min. Just amazing! Thanks so much I will be making these from now on!! Next time I want to add cheese to them.
These dumplings are sooo good!
My go to recipe for dumplings. I love it. It is quick and easy, my family says Mum the Best dumplings ever..

made chicken and dumplings with a cornish game hen for a slightly leaner broth, added 1 1/2 tbsp garlic powder 1 tbsp onion powder and 4 tbsp fresh dill to the dumpling mix. fantastic definitely recommend
too bready not a good texture
Didn‚Äôt make any changes. Easy and fast to make. My daughter loved them
Very good
Had to add more milk was too thick
I loved this recipe! I used my food processor and they turned out fluffy and light! No need to change up the recipe, it‚Äôs perfect!
Couldn‚Äôt find the biscuits powder so tried homemade. Loved them!!!!‚Äô
These dumplings were amazing, my husband & myself loved them. They were light & fluffy, just perfect.
They were awful. I followed the instructions to the letter. They were so doughy. Not at all light or fluffy. What went wrong, I had high hopes???
Excellent thanks for sharing
A happy taste memory of my childhood.ü•∞
I added a bit more flour and made it into balls instead of scooping it and it was sooo delicious
It was really really yummy.
I love this recipe!! I didn't make any changes and they turned out great. I'll never make dumplings different, my husband and I loved them. Thanks.
Easy and delicious!
These are perfect. The flavour is great. I didn't change a thing. I'll be using this recipe again.

It turned out perfect. I did add a lil extra flour and baking powder. Maybe 2 TBPS of Flour and 1/2 Teaspoon of Baking powder. Cooked 10 mins with lid off then 10 with lid on. It‚Äôs a hit!! Thanks for sharing
It was easy to make and yummy
I was looking for a recipe for light, fluffy dumplings and I found it! I have added this recipe to our family recipe file. VERY good!
Not too bad for my first try.
Amazing, will definitely make these again
Simple and quick. I added for my preference 1/2 tsp thyme, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1 /2 tsp onion powder, 1/4 tsp black pepper. I just wanted a little more flavor. Awesome recipe!!
This is similar to my usual dumpling recipe, but I would add a little chopped onion/onion powder and some mixed herbs next time. These are very plain to my taste.

I made a traditional meal my mother used to make called lobbies, or beef stew/hot pot for want of a better description. When I had finished cooking I thought some dumplings would be a great addition and googled this recipe. So so quick to knock up and made a great contrast to the stew. To add a little spice I also accompanied red pickled cabbage as a side...the dumplings were perfect. Thank you!
Love this recipe. I did sift the flour with the baking powder, sugar and salt. And easier to mix. Much better dumpling.
No changes!
My go to dumpling recipe. Tastes just like my mama always made.
Worked perfectly! I love watching the dumplings pop up after being in the boiling soup stock after about a minute.

recipe (mostly), added parsley flakes to dough mixture and turned out great. I rolled mine into about 1-2‚Äù balls and then pressed them down to about 1/4‚Äù thick before dropping into my chicken veg mixture. I used chicken broth instead of water and added some corn starch to thicken it up some. Note: need to cook dumplings until they sink into the soup/stew mixture to determine when they are done. We served over mashed potato‚Äôs. Delicious.
I made with soup I already had. Delicious. (I excluded the salt to avoid the soup from becoming salty)

Made as is with no changes. They are delicious! I wanted to make chicken and dumplings but didn‚Äôt have canned biscuits. Found this recipe to try. It was so easy and the dumplings turned out fantastic! Will be using this recipe from now on.
I was looking for another recipe so this one caught my eye and was my 2nd attempt at dumplings. They were fantastic! The butter and sugar makes all the difference.
I would add a pinch more salt but otherwise it's spot on!
Doubled up ingredients on dumplings. Used 1/4 cup cooking oil, cooked for 15 minutes in boiling Campbells cream of chicken or mushroom soup in separate large pot to have more dumplings
Great as is, didn't change a thing. Delicious
I did not like the texture of the cooked biscuit. I prefer mine more doughy
Roll into rope, cut into pillows, delicious!
Was ok but found them very heavy compared to most. They need to lighter just not sure how to do it.
The best dumplings ever. I added Italian seasoning and boiled them in chicken stock. I will make these again & again. Thank you!
I have made dumplings using this recipe a couple of times. Once I substituted expired heavy cream with a sprinkle of milk and it turned out great.
It tasted great. I used shortening rather than butter since I had some on hand. I doubled the recipe. Next time I will triple it. I'll make this again for sure, maybe even tomorrow.

These dumplings are so easy! I actually use slightly less than a tablespoon of Italian seasoning instead of parsley and it was still delicious! These are the best on my homemade chicken soup! Served over mashed potatoes, and this becomes the perfect winter supper!yummmmm!!!
I love it

I've made this recipe twice now, the first time I used them in chicken soup, when I dropped them they almost immediately fell apart and ruined the soup. I was cautious to try this recipe again but I figured I must have messed something up so I watched the video and followed the recipe exactly. second time around with a new batch of soup, they held up better but I made sure not to make the same mistake as last time, I tried just one as a sample let it cook the full time I pulled it out to try it and it was so soft and mushy. Maybe that's how they're supposed to be and maybe people like soft slimy dumplings but I'm used to a firmer texture and a little bit of a bite. I'm still on the search for a good dumpling recipe.
Simple and easy! Delicious results!
This recipe is awesome!! I added finely shredded cheddar cheese to the dumplings for our chicken soup!
Will never use bisquick again thanks best dumplings ever. Sorry grandma and mom no not sorry....

Today, I had to make some dumplings at work asap! My chef needed me to make dumplings for the chicken and dumplings. They turned out amazing! The people at the hospital are going to be happy! I had to multiply the recipe up to 12x and done 2 batches. Yummy!

the recipe definitely makes delicious, tender dumplings. I will for sure be making this again. The only issue I had, is that the pot kept bubbling over with the lid on. I had to keep lifting it to let it drop down. Not sure why. But great taste!
I used unsalted butter instead of margarine...but these were THE best soup dumplings I‚Äôve ever made

Oh my goodness! I have avoided learning how to make dumplings because my grandma, aunts and mom made the best. But they have all passed away. I‚Äôm so thankful I tried these! I‚Äôll be making these from now on! Yummy!!

I make chicken and dumplings at least once or twice a month but I got in the habit of using Bisquick. Never Again! This was so good! Light and fuffy, melt in your mouth dumplings! I just made this with our family's "secret ingredient" substitute... We make "corny dumplings" I use drained liquid from canned corn instead of milk and add half the corn in the chicken and half in the dumplings. I had to triple the recipe and it was all gobbled up!
Easy and very tasty used butter so good.
Very good and very easy to make. I used soy milk instead of whole milk and they were fluffy and just plain good. Will definitely make again.
Made these to go with Family‚Äôs Traditional Swedish Chicken & Dumplings and they are now my Favorite Dumpling step!!!!! EXCELLENT!!!!
I leave out the sugar and add an egg. Delicious.
I am eating my chicken noodle dumpling soup as I write this. It's really good. I like butter, not margarine, and would not know if it changed anything. I like the dumplings. It is a great recipe.
The dumplings were very light & fluffy. Hubby was a huge fan of them. Will definitely be making these again.
Easy , delicious and my kids gobbled them up. Of course I added pepper. And the parsley.

This recipe is excellent! I doubled the amount of salt and butter after reading various reviews. I reserved a potful of broth from my turkey soup to cook the dumplings in. I had to quadruple the recipe to feed my brood. The whole family loved them!!
These were perfect and delish!
What a wonderful recipe!I used Crisco & added fresh parsley.My family is enjoying their second bowl each on this rainy summer afternoon here on LI,NY.Thank you for the post
I have never seen anyone boil them for 15 min. But, I always try to follow the recipe and they turned into a mushy disaster. I am guessing it‚Äôs too long? Plus maybe I need to boil at a lower heat?
Quite good and easy to put together. I made a couple of minor changes. I added some black pepper and used butter since I do not use margarine. Glad I found it. Sorry but no pic, I ate 'em.
These were easy and terrific. I added some chopped parsley but otherwise no changes to the recipe. A keeper!
Wonderful recipe! I have no reason to buy frozen dumplings ever again. My five year old daughter even helped mix the dough. Thanks for sharing!
